<@U1ZFSBGPM|havinaykumar> has joined the channel

Hi All, I am able to deploy and write to a contract on local setup of hyperledger running inside docker container. But I am unable to read the values from the contract deployed. Here is the error "Error when querying chaincode: Error:Failed to launch chaincode spec(Could not get deployment transaction for c123c14a65a511ee79e2xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxe7abdf8812986ac3c5770a9c - LedgerError - ResourceNotFound: ledger: resource not found)'".  What am I missing ?
<@U1ZH7BL1J|jwiechers> has joined the channel
<@U1ZHV4UDD|abastys> has joined the channel

I am getting the exactly same error. Someone told me that if we clone new fabric code from gerrit and do our experiments after that, this error will be removed because the patch has been added for this in the new code.

<@U1RLLLQCU>: are u working outside of vagrant?
<@U1RLLLQCU>: have you rebuilt the images since getting the latest code? the peer code has changed to accommodate the docker API HostConfig changes

<@U1RLZ5729>: i m working inside vagrant, and i m trying to a simple development environment setup. Hence, I have just done clone of the github fabric repository, and then done 'vagrant up', and then started peer node with 'peer node start', and they tried to deploy a chaincode through the REST API.
<@U1LES78TT>: no, i havent rebuit the images, do i need to do that? i followed simple process as mentioned in the fabric developer setup, and also mentioned in response to <@U1RLZ5729>
ok, if you've only just cloned the repository, you probably built them from the (supposedly) working code anyway

<@U1RLLLQCU>: can you please check inside the archive build\image\src\gopath.tar.bz2
if your vendor\<http://github.com|github.com>\fsouza\go-dockerclient\container.go:688 checks for `c.serverAPIVersion.LessThan(apiVersion124)`
you could also check inside a peer container for the same file
<@U1LES78TT>: i checked inside container.go, but it doesn't have any entry for c.serverAPIVersion.LessThan(apiVersion124)
does your clone of the source mention it?
it should look like this: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/gitweb?p=fabric.git;a=blob;f=vendor/github.com/fsouza/go-dockerclient/container.go;h=281d3cca767edcb8809326205ae6306caa3ad37d;hb=HEAD>
see line :688
if anyone else is having the docker "HostConfig" errors, make sure you're using the latest code from <http://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/fabric> (not github)

<@U1LES78TT>: moving to gerrit from guthub, should also then resolve the "LedgerError - ResourceNotFound" errors on query/invoke api's, since this issue results because of previous errors during deployment of the chaincode
